item.title: Have COVID Impacted California Traffic Collisions?
An Overview on data.table R Package
item.description: The data.table package is one of the fastest packages for data manipulation, currently, it is even faster than pandas and dplyr 1. data.table syntax is dt[i, j, by], where: i is used to subset rows j is used to subset columns by is used to subset groups, like GROUP BY from SQL You can read it out loud as2: Take dt, subset/reorder rows using i, then calculate j, grouped by by.

item.title: Sentiment Analysis of Fake News vs Real News
item.description: I want to tackle sentiment analysis using R in a simple way, just to get me started. With this in mind we begin loading all the packages we’ll be using. library(readr) library(dplyr) library(tidytext) library(tokenizers) library(stopwords) library(ggplot2) Then we need to load our dataset. This data comes from Kaggle Fake and real news dataset. Fake <- read_csv('~/fakenews/Fake.csv') True <- read.csv('~/fakenews/True.csv') I want to merge the two datasets, but first we need to create a new column that will tell me where the data came from.

item.title: Python Guide for R Users
item.description: Python Guide for R Users is an upcoming project where I’m writing a guide to Python to help people who already know how to program in R or are just familiar with it and are learning/transitioning to Python. The project is going to be available here. Feel free to contribute to the project if you notice anything missing or incorrect.
